yeah, that worked better :)
hehe, reading your current comments... noting "which are just embarrassing" and "this doesn't look like something that should be published". LOL :D
My response to spelling mistakes is "I put them in on purpose to keep you on your toes:)"
i had a doc with something like "it is expected that no one will read this"
i think i actually had one person complain
i can't remember how many months it took before i got that one person
and it was from a publication group, not from the approval group
so i only need to deal w/ COMMENTS and QUESTIONS, i hope
doesn't have time to read the rest
yep
that's fine
sighs
the problem i have w/ commenting is people ask me to comment on their comments
it's a never ending battle
hehe. Yeah, sorry about that.
Promise not to do another round
i told someone to change an alarm clock pick sound dialog title
so they changed it
and sent me the new thing
which had an "add sound" option
sadly, "add" means "replace current custom sound", not "add another custom sound"
(there's no "remove")
so i decided to read their spec
which had something like 'beet' in one of the other human displayable strings
as a pair to 'been'
at which point i decided that i probably should read all of their strings...
woops. Yeah, once you go down one rat hole...
hrm, i need a way to say "ok" which doesn't sound like "ok" :o
"understood"?
got it
understood works
or "whatever..."
hrm, interesting
motivation is no longer sentences
much better :)
wait, it kinda is
please lose the '.'s at the end :)
or oh!
yeah sorry, i'm generally reading markup in text/plain
sighs
I'll add the "and" to those
ok
sorry, reading html hurts my eyes :)
i was actually reading the thing in a <textarea> using the windows High Contrast Black theme (in the dark)
You know, they have these things called "browsers" that actually render the HTML
yeah, those are what hurt my eyes :)
hehe
all these things in italics, and strnage lines all over the place...
and fancy colors....
Well, the aim was to have a pretty spec even to distract from the fact that the content might be crap.
suddenly remembers all this is being logged >.<
and you wonder why i don't like using irc for this stuff :)
i'm not saying that html is a bad thing... i do work on a browser after all
it's just that sometimes when you're tired and trying to review language, the last thing you want are distractions
the good thinig about html is that it can degrade to plain text
unlike some of the other formats i've dealt with of late, which make reviewing much more painful
yeah, I totally get that. I use my screen reader for proof reading.
heh
Seriously, using both audio and visual helps quite a bit (in my case at least).
People think I'm rude when I go to meeting because I always have my headset on, but that's only because I use my screen reader religiously.
Maybe I'll start carrying around a blind walking cane so people will not bother me.
heh
